bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, November 28, 1898

div1.p: Lawrence Reed arrives safely at Camp Onward.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, Emilie Lawrence Reed, and Blossom Reed, November 28, 1898
div1.opener:
Sunday. night.
Send me some stamps Please
Dear People-
div1.p:
The name of our Camp
is Onward, have had a fine
trip, was sorry to have missed
you all, Am well & happy
working like a dog. have got
to go on Guard tomorrow -
so must go to bed early - its
9. now. Will write soon--
am broke, Did you give
Sergt Shillington $5 for me, he
said you did but as he was
drunk I didn't believe him
div1.closer: Love to all Lawrence Excuse haste
